Key Match Events: The Kings went on a 17-2 run to end the third quarter and take an 83-77 lead.
The Mavericks were without their top three scorers but kept the game close until the fourth.
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie got his first win as the interim head coach after the Kings fired Mike Brown last week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were without Kyrie Irving (shoulder), Klay Thompson (illness), Dereck Lively II (hip) and Naji Marshall (suspension), in addition to Luka Doncic being out for at least the next month with a calf strain.
Others: Spencer Dinwiddie and PJ Washington both had season highs for the Mavericks. Dinwiddie scored 30 points and Washington had 28.
